### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Candidate and Buildable Validation:
 – Validate candidate positions for electrical components by ensuring sufficient clearance and verifying that no nearby pipes or other entities (such as chests or generators) occupy the intended placement tile. Adjust spacing and direction as needed.
• Pole Placement Conflicts:
 – When placing small electric poles adjacent to steam engines or labs, precheck for collisions with pipes, existing poles, or fixed entities (e.g. a wooden chest) to prevent placement failures.  
 – Multiple failures due to occupancy errors indicate the need to test alternative spacings or directions before committing to a placement.
• Variable and Assignment Errors:
 – Resolve NameError issues by ensuring that newly placed entities (for example, a new pole) are properly assigned to variables prior to their use in subsequent connection steps.
• General Resource and Connection Management:
 – Pre-calculate material requirements and verify inventory levels before initiating pipe connections or crafting operations.  
 – Confirm that all required ingredients are available before initiating production processes and monitor inventory capacity to avoid overflow.
• Electrical Network Merge:
 – Ensure that target tiles for merging electrical components are unoccupied; craft and maintain sufficient quantities of poles to support network expansions.
• Lab Power Connection:
 – If a lab remains unpowered despite a connection attempt, review proximity conflicts and consider whether alternative connection methods (or additional power-supplying components) are necessary.
